meanings.definition: A structure built along the edge of a body of water, used for loading and unloading ships.
meanings.sent1: The quais by the harbor were bustling with activity as ships docked for unloading.
meanings.sent2: The workers carried crates along the quais to the waiting ships.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls perched on the quais, hoping for a snack from the fishermen.
meanings.sent4: The quais stood like loyal guardians, guiding the ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The salty breeze danced along the quais, carrying tales of distant lands.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'quai', meaning a platform or landing place at a port or harbor.
meanings.sent1: The sailors gathered at the quais to prepare for their voyage.
meanings.sent2: Tourists strolled along the quais, admiring the view of the harbor.
meanings.sent3: The children played hide-and-seek among the quais, giggling with delight.
meanings.sent4: The quais welcomed the ships like old friends returning home.
meanings.sent5: The lanterns lit up the quais, casting a warm glow over the harbor.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'quai', meaning a street or road along the edge of a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The cafes along the quais offered a perfect view of the sunset over the water.
meanings.sent2: Couples walked hand in hand along the quais, enjoying the peaceful evening.
meanings.sent3: The vendors set up stalls along the quais, selling fresh seafood to passersby.
meanings.sent4: The lights from the boats reflected on the quais, creating a magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The sound of laughter echoed along the quais, blending with the gentle lapping of the waves.
